sentences.text: The 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders of Range Resources Corporation (the Annual Meeting or the Meeting), a Delaware corporation (Range or the Company), will be held at The Worthington Renaissance Hotel, Bur Oak Room, 200 Main Street, Fort Worth, Texas on Wednesday, May 17, 2017 at 8:00 a.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Central Time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purposes of the meeting, as more fully described in the attached Proxy Statement, are:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. To elect the eleven nominees named in the attached Proxy Statement to our Board of Directors, each for a term expiring at the 2018 annual meeting or when their successors are duly elected and qualified;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. To consider and vote on a non-binding proposal to approve our executive compensation philosophy (say on pay);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: public accounting firm as of and for the fiscal year ending December 31, 2017; 5.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Business Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to our focus on operating safely and as a good steward of the environment and the communities where we work, our growth strategy in the past years can be summarized in two key points:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Grow production and reserves on a debt-adjusted, per share basis at top-quartile or better costs; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Maintain a strong, simple balance sheet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a leader in the discovery and development of the Marcellus Shale, we have had great success in the growth of production and reserves.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From 2011 to 2016, we grew debt-adjusted production per share at a 20% compound annual growth rate (CAGR) while growing debt-adjusted reserves per share at a 12% CAGR.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since 2015, due to the significant downturn in oil prices and the further erosion of natural gas prices, especially realized prices in our key operating areas in Pennsylvania where weak demand, increased supply and limited pipeline transportation have resulted in dramatically lower sales prices for gas, NGLs and oil, we have shifted our focus away from growth to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: capital discipline and capital efficiency;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: development of reserves with acceptable economic returns;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: cost reduction and containment; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: maximizing balance sheet flexibility and strength.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Due to the continued low commodity price environment, we took additional action in 2016 to reduce operating costs and general and administrative costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our capital budget for 2017 is currently $1.15 billion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 initiatives included additional workforce reductions, and in February 2016, the board of directors approved a reduction of our quarterly dividend from $0.04 per share to $0.02 per share.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In September 2016, we completed our merger with Memorial Resource Development Corp. (Memorial) through the issuance of 77.0 million shares of Range common stock in exchange for all outstanding shares of Memorial using an exchange ratio of 0.375 of a share of Range common stock for each share of Memorial common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This merger adds an additional premier onshore U.S. natural gas resource play to our existing core operating areas.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The North Louisiana location provides geographic and marketing diversity to our high quality Appalachia basin assets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We anticipate continuing to improve drilling and well performance in this play by applying best practices from our Marcellus division and capitalizing on synergies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that demand for our products, especially natural gas, will more closely align with supply in the future and that will drive more economically rational commodity prices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At that time, when economic returns justify it, we expect to be positioned to increase our development of our core operating assets, grow production and reserves and accelerate value creation for our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation Advisory Vote
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are asking our stockholders to approve, on an advisory basis, the compensation we pay our Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board recommends a FOR vote because we believe our compensation policies and practices are effective in achieving our goals of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) aligning our executives interests with those of our stockholders, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) encouraging a strong performance focus to address both the short-term challenges and the long-term growth of the Company along with creation of value for our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation program for our executives is somewhat complicated as it is designed to be retrospective but this design creates a unique opportunity to focus on pay for performance as compared to
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: our peers as explained below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, our compensation policies have been created or revised to avoid or eliminate pay practices viewed by our Board and our stockholders as contrary to a performance driven focus such as:    No employment contracts (none of our executives are covered by an employment contract);      No executive severance program except in the case of a change in control;      Change in control benefits which are consistent with our peers; and      Benefits are comparable to those offered to all employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RANGE RESOURCES CORPORATION - 2017 Proxy Statement    6
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Back to Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While our Companys operational results have been strong, like many other natural gas and oil companies, our stock performance in two of the last three years has been negative, with our Total Stockholder Return in 2014 equal to a negative 36% and 2015 Total Stockholder Return equal to a negative 54%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Total Stockholder Return was equal to a positive 40% but our stockholders have seen their holdings in Range decrease in value over time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation policies and the use of equity awards in the form of time vested restricted stock and performance restricted stock has resulted in a decrease in realizable compensation demonstrating a strong pay for performance linkage in our compensation practice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As explained below in more detail, our CEOs equity compensation which was awarded in May 2016 was based on 2015 Company performance utilizing 2015 data reported by our peer group at a target level of $7.5 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, however, that unvested equity award had a value of $3.6 million, or only 48% of the amount at which the award was valued on the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The dramatic reduction in the value of the compensation awarded to our CEO over less than a years time is a direct and intended result of our executive compensation policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Objectives and Principles of Our Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to achieve alignment between performance of the Company and pay for our employees and alignment of the long-term interests of our executives with those of our stockholders, we use the following key principles:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Must be Performance-Based- a significant portion of our executives total compensation should be tied to how well they perform individually and should be at risk based on how well the Company performs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Must Reinforce Our Business Objectives and Values- we consider our key strategies for achieving our business vision when identifying incentive measures and assigning goals and objectives and maintain flexibility in that regard.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our long-term focus remains on cost effective growth of production and reserves while our short-term goals are capital discipline, cost reduction and containment and balance sheet flexibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The combination of long-term and short-term compensation is used to balance these different goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance-Based Compensation Must be Benchmarked- our performance metrics are regularly compared to an industry-appropriate, high performing external benchmark to effectively measure Company performance compared to peers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Total Compensation Must be Market Competitive Based on Relevant Peers- our executive compensation program is compared to verified market data using information disclosed by peer companies in their SEC filings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While this results in a lag in reporting our compensation, it results in a more disciplined approach to the initial award of executive compensation than would the use of more current salary survey data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At Risk Incentive Compensation for Executives Must Represent the Majority of Total Compensation- the proportion of an executives total compensation that is at risk based on individual or Company performance should increase with the scope and level of responsibilities and should be the majority of compensation for executives of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our CEOs at risk compensation is thus the highest percentage of at risk compensation in our Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Incentive Compensation Must Balance Short-Term and Long-Term Performance- we use annual cash incentive opportunities and long-term equity-based awards to address the Companys short and long-term performance objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Executive Compensation Program is Reviewed Annually for Effectiveness- our Compensation Committee conducts an annual review of all executive compensation program components with the advice of its independent consultants to ensure alignment with our compensation objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation Elements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Category  Compensation Element  Description and terms Equity    Restricted stock   Amount granted is based on a comparison of the Companys actual performance to the Companys peers; restricted stock vests 30%, 30%, 40% annually over three years for retention purposes and to align the value with longer term performance      Performance restricted stock   Performance restricted stock will ultimately vest at the end of the three year performance period and payout, if any, is based solely on relative total stockholder return (TSR).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beginning in 2017, performance restricted stock will also include stock that will ultimately vest at the end of the three year performance period and payout, if any, will be based on reserves added and production added per debt adjusted share Cash    Base salary  Annual cash bonus   Reviewed annually  base compensation is targeted at 50th percentile to increase at risk compensation as a percentage of total compensation  Determined by Compensation Committee based on quantitative market metrics and peer comparisons Retirement    Tax-qualified Plan   Comparable 401(k) plan matching contributions as available to all full time employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred compensation plan matching which vests over three years and is available to all officers Other   Standard benefits  Life, health and disability insurance comparable to other employees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described more fully in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis section of this Proxy Statement, our Compensation Committee believes it is important to review and compare our financial and operating performance with that of our peers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining an individual Senior Executive total compensation to be awarded, the Compensation Committee reviewed the compensation paid in 2015 as compiled from the 2016 proxy data reported by the Peer Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, the compensation disclosed in this Proxy Statement was awarded in May 2016 but is measured based on the Companys performance in 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This lag can be misinterpreted especially when in the time between the year where performance was the basis of the award and the publication of the proxy statement with the disclosure of the awards, the Companys performance has significantly declined.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In summary, the process used to set 2016 Executive Compensation was:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In May 2016, the Compensation Committee reviewed the Companys key performance metrics for calendar year 2015 (the prior fiscal year) and compared the results to the Peer Group to determine the percentile of the Companys performance;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In May 2016, the Compensation Committee was provided a detailed report from the independent compensation consultants which was based o the 2016 proxy disclosures of the Peer Group analyzing the total compensation of each executive paid by the Peer Group for 2015; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Using both the Peer Group compensation disclosures and the Companys percentile performance compared to the Peer Group, the Compensation Committee determines the Total Compensation awarded in May 2016 for each Range executive based on the 2015 metrics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with that process, executive compensation for the Companys performance in 2016 will not be awarded until May 2017, at which time the Companys relative performance and any change in the Companys stock price will be considered by the Compensation Committee in establishing each executives total compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The non-equity incentive plan compensation reported in this Proxy Statement was awarded in February 2017, is based on formulaic disclose metrics and is calculated based on the Companys performance in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continued Review of Compensation Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We continue to seek ways to enhance our compensation program to ensure that it remains linked to Company performance:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, in light of persistent low commodity prices and the corresponding effect on the Companys stock performance, no Named Executive Officer received a base compensation increase in 2016 (page 52);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjustments to our compensation peer group are made annually to ensure that it continues to be relevant (page 39);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: One  half of all equity awards granted to our Senior Executives in 2016 were granted in the form of performance shares - restricted stock which will ultimately vest at the end of the three year performance period and the amount, if any, that will be paid is based solely on relative total shareholder return performance for the three year period following the year of the award (page 43);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have a policy limiting the amount of equity held by an officer which can be pledged as security for a credit line (page 48) and effective May 18, 2016 the Company has adopted a policy to preclude Directors and Senior Executives from pledging additional stock in the future and to preclude any Senior Executive from opening a new account which has credit secured by Company securities (page 48); and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have adopted stock ownership guidelines for Senior Executives and Directors which require retention of a specified portion of all equity grants until the ownership multiple is held.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All Named Executive Officers and Directors (not including our two-newest directors) currently meet the stock ownership policy requirements (page 48).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders proposals submitted for inclusion in our 2018 proxy statement pursuant to Securities Exchange Act of 1934 Rule 14a-8 must be received by us no later than December 8, 2017.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. Why did I receive these proxy materials?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are providing these materials in connection with the solicitation by the Board of Directors (the Board) of Range Resources Corporation, a Delaware corporation, of proxies to be voted at our 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders (the Meeting) and at any adjournment or postponement of the Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Meeting will take place on May 17, 2017, beginning at 8:00 a.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Central Time, at The Worthington Renaissance Hotel, Bur Oak Room, 200 Main Street, Fort Worth, Texas 76102.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. What is the difference between holding shares as a stockholder of record and as a beneficial owner?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your shares are registered directly in your name with Ranges registrar and transfer agent, Computershare Investor Services LLC, you are a stockholder of record with respect to these shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If, as is more typical, your shares are held in a brokerage account or by your bank, broker or other third party, you are the beneficial owner of these shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because a beneficial owner is not the stockholder of record, you may not vote these shares in person at the meeting unless you obtain a proxy from the broker, trustee or nominee that holds your shares, giving you the right to vote the shares at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your broker, trustee or nominee has enclosed or provided voting instructions for you to use in directing the broker, trustee or nominee how to vote your shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. What shares are included on the proxy card?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a stockholder of record, you will receive only one proxy card for all the shares you hold of record in certificate form and in book-entry form.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: f you are a Range employee, you will receive a proxy or voting instruction card for all the shares you may hold in the Range 401(k) Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your proxy card will serve as a voting instruction card for the Plan trustee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you do not specify your voting instructions on the proxy card, the Plan trustee will vote your shares in the same proportion as it votes shares for which it did receive timely instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To allow sufficient time for voting by the rustee, your voting instructions must be received no later than 5:00 p.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eastern Time on May 16, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4. What different methods can I use to vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voting In Person.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares held in your name as the stockholder of record may be voted in person at the Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares held beneficially in street name may be voted in person only if you obtain a proxy from the broker, trustee or nominee that holds your shares giving you the right to vote the shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Even if you plan to attend the Meeting, we recommend that you also submit your proxy or voting instructions so that your vote will be counted if you later decide not to attend the Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By Written Proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All stockholders of record can vote by written proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a stockholder of record and receive a notice regarding the availability of proxy materials, you may request a written proxy card by following the instructions included in the notice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a beneficial owner, you may request a written proxy card or a voting instruction form from your bank, broker or other nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By Telephone or Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All stockholders of record can vote by calling the toll-free telephone number on the proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please have your proxy card when you call.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voice prompts will direct you on how to vote your shares and will confirm that your voting instructions have been recorded properly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders of record may also vote by accessing the website noted on the proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please have your proxy card when you go to the website.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beneficial owners may vote by telephone or Internet if their bank, broker or other nominee makes those methods available, in which case the bank, broker or other nominee will include the instructions with the proxy materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Back to Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Default Voting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A proxy that is properly completed and returned will be voted at the Meeting in accordance with the instructions on the proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you properly complete and return a proxy but do not indicate any voting instructions, your shares will be voted in the manner recommended by the Board on all matters presented in this Proxy Statement and as the proxy holders may determine in their discretion with respect to any other matters properly presented for a vote at the Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If we propose to adjourn the Meeting, proxy holders will vote all shares for which they have voting authority in favor of adjournment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors knows of no matters other than those stated in the Notice of Annual Meeting of Stockholders and described in the Proxy Statement to be presented for consideration at the annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5. What are my voting choices for each of the proposals to be voted at the 201 Annual Meeting of Stockholders and what are the voting standards?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal    Voting Choices and Board Recommendation  Voting Standard Proposal
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. Election of Directors   vote in favor of all nominees;  vote in favor of specific nominees;  vote against all nominees;  vote against specific nominees;  abstain from voting with respect to all nominees; or  abstain from voting with respect to specific nominees.

sentences.text: The Board recommends a vote FOR each of the nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Majority of votes cast Proposal

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Majority of shares present and entitled to vote Proposal

sentences.text: The Board recommends a vote for annual (ONE YEAR) advisory vote.

sentences.text: 6. What if I am a beneficial owner and do not give voting instructions to my broker?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a beneficial owner, in order to ensure your shares are voted in the way you would like, you must provide voting instructions to your bank, broker or other nominee by the deadline provided in the materials you receive from your bank, broker or other nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you do not provide voting instructions to your bank, broker or other nominee, whether your shares can be voted by such person depends on the type of item being considered to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-Discretionary Items.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The election of directors, the advisory vote concerning executive compensation, the advisory vote concerning the frequency of future advisory votes concerning executive compensation, and the stockholder proposal, if presented, are non-discretionary items and may not be voted on by brokers, banks or other nominees who have not received specific voting instructions from beneficial owners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Discretionary Items.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ratification of the appointment of Ernst & Young LLP as Independent Auditors is a discretionary item.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally banks, brokers and other nominees that do not receive voting instructions from beneficial owners may vote on the proposal at their discretion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 7. How are abstentions and broker non-votes counted?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 1.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Election of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you abstain from voting in the election of directors, you have not cast a vote and the abstention will not be counted in determining the outcome of the election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Broker non-votes are not considered a vote cast under our by-laws and will have no effect on the outcome of the election of directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 2.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Advisory Vote to Approve Executive Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you abstain from voting on the advisory vote to approve executive compensation, you are considered present and entitled to vote, and your shares are considered in the calculation of whether Proposal 2 received the affirmative vote of a majority of shares present and entitled to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The effect of an abstention is a vote against Proposal 2.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Broker non-votes will have no effect on the outcome of Proposal 2 because broker non-votes are not entitled to vote and are not considered in the calculation of a majority of shares present and entitled to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 3.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Advisory Vote on Frequency of Presentation of Say on Pay to Stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you abstain from voting on the advisory vote on the frequency of the presentation of Say on Pay votes to stockholders, you have not cast a vote and the abstention will not be counted in determining the outcome of the election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Broker non-votes will have no effect on the outcome of Proposal 3 because broker non-votes are not entitled to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 4.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ratification of Appointment of Ernst & Young LLP as Independent Auditors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you abstain from voting on the ratification of Ernst & Young LLP as Ranges independent auditors, you are considered present and entitled to vote, and your shares are considered in the calculation of whether Proposal 4 received the affirmative vote of a majority of shares present and entitled to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The effect of an abstention is a vote against Proposal 4.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because Proposal 4 is a routine matter on which a broker has discretionary authority, no broker non-votes likely will result from this Proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 5.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To consider and vote on the stockholder proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you abstain from voting on the stockholder proposal, you are considered present and entitled to vote, and your shares are considered in the calculation of whether Proposal 5 received the affirmative vote of a majority of shares present and entitled to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The effect of an abstention is a vote against Proposal 5.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Broker non-votes will have no effect on the outcome of Proposal 5 because broker non-votes are not entitled to vote and are not considered in the calculation of a majority of shares present and entitled to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you hold your shares in a brokerage account or by other nominee and deliver voting instructions to the record holder of those shares, you may only revoke the voting of those shares in accordance with your instruction if the record holder revokes the original proxy as directed above and either resubmits a proxy reflecting your voting instructions or delivers to you a legal proxy giving you the right to vote the shares.

sentences.text: 13. What is householding?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As permitted by the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the Exchange Act), only one copy of this Proxy Statement is being delivered to stockholders residing at the same address, unless the stockholders have notified Range of their desires to receive multiple copies of the Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This is known as householding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon oral or written request, we will promptly deliver a separate copy of the Proxy Statement to any stockholder residing at an address to which only one copy was mailed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Direct requests for additional copies for the current year or future years to our Corporate Secretary, 100 Throckmorton Street, Suite 1200, Fort Worth, Texas 76102 or our Investor Relations team at (817) 869-4258.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders of record residing at the same address and currently receiving multiple copies of the Proxy Statement may contact our registrar and transfer agent, Computershare, to request a single copy be mailed in the future.

sentences.text: Beneficial owners should contact their broker or bank.

sentences.text: Please note that if you request a legal proxy, any previously executed proxy will be revoked, and your vote will not be counted unless you appear at the Meeting and vote in person or legally appoint another proxy to vote on your behalf.

sentences.text: As a result, the current term of all our directors expires at the 2017 annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the recommendation received from the Governance and Nominating Committee, our Board of Directors proposes that each of the nominees listed below, all of whom are currently serving as directors, be elected for a new term expiring at the 2018 annual meeting or when their successors are duly elected and qualified.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the nominees has agreed to serve if elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any one of them becomes unavailable to serve as a director, our Board of Directors may designate a substitute nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In that case, the persons named as proxies will vote for the substitute nominee designated by our Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors does not presently contemplate that any of the nominees will become unavailable for election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Required Vote and Recommendation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since it is an uncontested election of directors, each nominee must receive more votes for the nominee than votes cast against the nominee in order for the nominee to be elected to the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our by-laws, in the event a candidate for the board does not receive more for votes than votes against, the candidates resignation from the Board will be considered by the Governance and Nominating Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A properly executed proxy marked Abstain with respect to the election of one or more of our directors will not be voted with respect to the director or directors indicated, although it will be counted for purposes of determining whether a quorum is present.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Uninstructed shares are not entitled to vote on this proposal; therefore, broker non-votes will not affect the outcome of this proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxies cannot be voted for a greater number of persons than the number of nominees named.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the reasons described at the end of each biographical information for each candidate which discusses the skills, qualifications and attributes that led the Governance and Nominating Committee to recommend such persons for election to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors recommends a vote FOR the election of each of the nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event of a contested election of directors, a nominee would be required to receive a plurality of the votes of the holders of shares of our common stock present in person or by proxy and entitled to vote at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our by-laws, an uncontested election is an election in which the number of nominees for director is not greater than the number to be elected and a contested election is an election in which the number of nominees for director is greater than the number to be elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Qualifications
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Corporate Governance Guidelines contain criteria that apply to nominees recommended by the Governance and Nominating Committee for positions on our Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under these criteria, members of our Board of Directors should:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: have high professional and personal ethics and values;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: have broad experience in management, policy-making and/or finance;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: commit to enhancing stockholder value;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: have sufficient time to carry out their duties and to provide insight and practical wisdom based on their experience and knowledge;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: limit their service on other boards of other public companies to a number that permits them, given their individual circumstances, to perform their expected duties; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: represent the interests of all stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors prefers to have a reasonable number of directors who have experience within the oil and gas industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board has also adopted a policy with regard to the consideration of diversity in the selection of candidates for the Board of Directors and that policy has been included in the Governance and Nominating Committees charter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the nominees for director is now a member of the Board of Directors, which met 20 times during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the nominees for director attended at least 75% of the combined Board and Committee meetings held during the periods served by such nominee in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have provided below, key attributes, skills and experience that led the Board to conclude that the nominee should serve as a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director compensation is set by the Compensation Committee after working with its independent compensation consultants and a review of the Peer Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee generally approves compensation for directors just prior to the Board of Directors meeting following the election of directors at the annual meeting of stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation arrangements for directors are effective with each election to the Board of Directors at the annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the past several years, the Compensation Committee has also approved the payment of Annual Stock Awards to the directors for a portion of their overall director compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since director long-term equity incentive awards are granted upon director elections at the annual meeting, the timing of director long-term equity incentive awards is not a subjective matter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Stock Awards are fully vested upon grant and the amounts shown in the 2016 Director Compensation table reflect the grant date fair value of the awards actually granted during calendar year 2016 (May 2016 for all Directors who were elected at the Annual Stockholder Meeting).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Certain directors may voluntarily elect to defer all or a portion of their cash fees in our Active Deferred Compensation Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors have the power to change their investment options in the Deferred Compensation Plans among the funds listed on page 58 under Non-Qualified Deferred Compensation Plans.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors has considered the issue of director independence and determined that, except for Mr. Jeffrey L. Ventura, our current Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer, none of the current directors standing for election, specifically, Brenda A. Cline, Anthony V. Dub, Allen Finkelson, James M. Funk, Christopher A. Helms, Robert A. Innamorati, Mary Ralph Lowe, Greg G. Maxwell, Kevin S. McCarthy and Steffen E. Palko, have a material relationship with our Company (either directly or as a partner, stockholder or officer of an organization that has a relationship with us) and each of these directors is independent within the meaning of our director independence standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our director independence standards are included in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, available under the Corporate Governance section of our website at www.rangersources.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our director independence standards reflect the standards required by the NYSE, and SEC rules as currently in effect.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Furthermore, our Board of Directors has determined that each of the current members of each of the committees, has no material relationship with us (directly or as a partner, stockholder or officer of an organization that has a relationship with us) and is independent within the meaning of our director independence standards.

sentences.text: Proxy Access Nominees For Director
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In response to a stockholder proposal submitted to a vote of the Companys stockholders in May 2015, the Companys Board of Directors adopted new provisions of the Companys by-laws to allow a stockholder or group of stockholders that meet certain criteria and requirements to nominate candidates for election to the Board and have such persons included in the Companys proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The basic requirements to be met in order to submit a candidate for election to the Board utilizing proxy access are that a stockholder or group of stockholders comprised of no more than 20 unaffiliated stockholders must have owned at least 3% of the outstanding common stock of the Company for at least 3 years in order to submit a nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The maximum number of nominees is 20% of the Board or 2 whichever is greater.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you wish to utilize the Companys proxy access process, you must submit the information required under the by-laws to the Company not less than one hundred and twenty (120) days nor more than one hundred and fifty (150) days prior to the first anniversary of the date that the Company first distributed its proxy statement to stockholders for the previous years Annual Meeting (i.e. April 7, 2018).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Copies of the Companys by-laws are available on the Companys website at www.rangeresources.com or upon request addressed to the Companys Corporate Secretary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any questions regarding the Companys proxy access procedures may be directed to the Companys Corporate Secretary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risk Oversight by the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of the function of the Board and the Audit, Compensation and Governance and Nominating Committees, the Directors of the Company evaluate the risks of the Company and oversee such risk identification and evaluation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board regularly discusses the issues, both internally and externally, that could present risks in the success and growth of the Company including financial risks, operational risks, regulatory risks and other risks inherent in the operation of the Company and created or which could be created by internal or external factors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Among the issues the Board regularly considers are risks associated with regulation (or potential regulation) of the Companys operations and the environmental issues associated with the Companys operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys Board of Directors retains oversight of environmental, health and safety issues and any related social concerns that might arise from the Companys operations rather than delegating that responsibility to a Committee of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As stewards of our stockholders capital, the Board believes that the concerns of third party constituents, especially the communities in which we operate, are integral to the Companys overall continuing performance and the protection and creation of stockholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, the Board provides direct oversight of the Companys policies and performance with regard to environmental, health and safety and any other related third party concerns by conducting regular reviews of the Companys management of and strategic approach to these issues, including providing feedback to management concerning the Companys reporting and external communications with respect to these issues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, when undertaking a major business decision, the Board takes into consideration any impact such decision might have on these issues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compliance & Reporting Operating & Strategic Range Board Audit Committee Compensation Committee Oversight   Governance and Nominating Committee Range Management Compliance Reviews Business Plan Review Day  to  Day Sarbanes  Oxley Compliance Risk Management Committee   Internal Controls     Disclosure Committee

sentences.text: The Audit Committee plays a central role in the Boards oversight of internal risks, by evaluating the Companys financial reporting, by supervising the internal audit function, interfacing with the independent auditor, regularly communicating with the Chief Financial Officer and other members of management, monitoring the Companys compliance programs, including the Companys third party anonymous hotline for the notification of compliance concerns, supervising the investigation of any alleged financial fraud, monitoring the Companys internal risk forums and the Companys enterprise risk management program (the responsibility for which the Audit Committee shares with the Board).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee considers the possible risk implications of the Companys various compensation programs and plans and monitors the elements of such compensation programs so that risk in the behavior of the employees of the Company, including its Senior Executives, is considered in such policies and programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance and Nominating Committee is responsible for the oversight of the Companys governance processes and monitors those processes including the Companys Code of Business Conduct and Business Ethics, compliance function, Board Committee Charters and Board annual evaluations to evaluate their effectiveness in avoiding the creation of risk to the Company and providing for proper and effective governance of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Review and Approval of Related Person Transactions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Governance and Nominating Committee Charter includes a provision regarding the review and approval of related person transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Governance and Nominating Committee is charged with reviewing transactions which would require disclosure under our filings under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, or the Exchange Act, and related rules, as a related person transaction, and making a recommendation to our Board of Directors regarding the initial authorization or ratification of any such transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If our Board of Directors considers ratification of a related person transaction and determines not to ratify the transaction, management is required to make all reasonable efforts to cancel or annul such transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining whether or not to recommend the approval or ratification of a related person transaction, our Governance and Nominating Committee will consider the relevant facts and circumstances including, if applicable:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: whether there is an appropriate business justification for the transaction;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the benefits that accrue to us as a result of the transaction;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the terms available to unrelated third parties entering into similar transactions;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the impact of the transaction on a directors independence (in the event the related person is a director, an immediate family member of a director or an entity in which a director is a partner, stockholder or executive officer);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the availability of other sources for comparable products or services;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: whether it is a single transaction or a series of ongoing, related transactions; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: whether entering into the transaction would be consistent with our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No related person transaction in an amount exceeding $120,000 occurred during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consideration of Stockholder Nominees for Director
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy of our Governance and Nominating Committee is to consider stockholder nominations for director candidates as described below under Identifying and Evaluating Nominees for Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In evaluating such nominations and in evaluating the composition of the Board, our Governance and Nominating Committee seeks to achieve a balance of knowledge, experience and capability on our Board of Directors and to address the membership criteria set forth under Director Qualifications including diversity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any stockholder nominations proposed for consideration by our Governance and Nominating Committee should include the nominees name and qualifications for Board of Directors membership, meet the requirements set forth in our by-laws and should be addressed to: Corporate Secretary, Range Resources Corporation, 100 Throckmorton Street, Suite 1200, Fort Worth, Texas 76102.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Identifying and Evaluating Board Nominees for Directors, including Diversity Considerations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Governance and Nominating Committee uses a variety of avenues to identify and evaluate director nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee regularly assesses the appropriate size of our Board of Directors and whether any vacancies on our Board of Directors are expected due to retirement or otherwise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If vacancies are anticipated, or otherwise arise, our Governance and Nominating Committee considers various potential candidates for the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Candidates may come to the attention of the Committee through current Board members, stockholders or other persons.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Candidates may be evaluated at regular or special meetings of the Committee, and may be considered at any point during the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee also considers any stockholder nominations for candidates for our Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following verification of the stockholder status of persons proposing candidates, recommendations are provided to and considered by our Governance and Nominating Committee at a regularly scheduled meeting, which is generally the first or second meeting before the issuance of the proxy statement for our annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any materials are provided by a stockholder in connection with the nomination of a director candidate, such materials are forwarded to our Governance and Nominating Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Governance and Nominating Committee also reviews materials provided by other parties in connection with a nominee who is not proposed by a stockholder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In evaluating such nominations, our Governance and Nominating Committee seeks to achieve a balance of knowledge, experience and capability on our Board of Directors and evaluates the experience, skills, abilities and qualifications of each candidate and considers the diversity of the current members of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Governance and Nominating Committee does not currently expect to use a paid
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: third-party in identifying potential directors but if it does, it is committed to having any such third party seek candidates

sentences.text: While the Company acknowledges that having an officer of the Company as Chairman can present an issue for some companies or some boards, the Company, the Governance and Nominating Committee and the Board do not believe there is any material corporate governance benefit to limiting the position of Chairman of the Board to the non-management directors or only independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board considered the advantages and disadvantages to the election of the current CEO to the position of Chairman and determined that it was in the best interest of the Board and the Company to elect Mr. Ventura as Chairman.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board considered, among other factors, the fact that the Chairman of the Board does not have any enhanced rights as a director, but has the same voting authority as all other directors and the role of Chairman is principally that of presiding at Board meetings and taking the initiative on establishing the proposed agenda for Board meetings, which is a role senior management of the Company would play a significant part in regardless of which director serves as Chairman.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, the Board has maintained a Lead Independent Director and among the expectations for the Lead Independent Director is for that individual to be involved in setting the agenda for Board meetings as well as facilitating regular communications between the independent members of the Board and the Chairman with regard to their interest in having particular issues or topics addressed in a Board meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, input from the independent members of the Board is consistently and regularly considered in developing the Boards agenda regardless of the Director who serves as Chairman.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, the Board has established a Board calendar which includes a number of regular agenda items to ensure that the Board spends an appropriate amount of time considering the key matters which are important to the growth and development of the Company at regular and established intervals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result of these various factors,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the Company does not believe there is any corporate governance enhancement or benefit to the Company or its stockholders if it were to require that the Chairman be elected from the non-management or independent members of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 2 ADVISORY VOTE TO APPROVE EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company and the Board of Directors recognize that executive compensation is an important matter for our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described in detail in the Compensation Committees report and the Compensation Discussion and Analysis section of this Proxy Statement, the Compensation Committee is tasked with the implementation of the Companys executive compensation philosophy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The core of that philosophy has been and continues to be to structure our compensation programs so the compensation of the Companys executives is largely based on the Companys performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In particular, the Compensation Committee strives to base a substantial portion of executive compensation on performance metrics that are based on finding and development of oil and gas reserves at reasonable cost and the consequent long-term increase in the value of the Company for its owners  the stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is always the intention of the Compensation Committee that the Companys executive officers be compensated competitively and consistently with the Companys strategy, sound corporate governance principles, and stockholder interests and concerns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis section of this Proxy Statement, we believe our compensation program has a significant performance component and aligns the long-term interests of our stockholders with our executives interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As you consider this proposal, we urge you to read the Compensation Discussion and Analysis section of this Proxy Statement for additional details on executive compensation, including the more detailed information about the Companys compensation philosophy and objectives and the past compensation of the Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The legislation requiring a non-binding, advisory Say on Pay vote on executive compensation was first effective in 2011 and the first such vote was received by the Company at its annual meeting in May 2011, at which time a majority of stockholders also voted in favor of the submission of the say on pay vote annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the advisory vote on the frequency preference for the say on pay vote, the Board determined to submit such a vote again this year and welcomes the opportunity for our stockholders to provide us with a say on pay vote on executive compensation at our 2017 annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are therefore asking stockholders to vote on the following resolution:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, that the stockholders approve the compensation of the Named Executive Officers as disclosed in this Proxy Statement pursuant to the SECs compensation disclosure rules, including the Compensation Discussion and Analysis and the compensation tables.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Required Vote and Recommendation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As an advisory vote, the matter for which stockholders have the opportunity to vote under Proposal 2 is non-binding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the vote is non-binding, the Board of Directors and the Compensation Committee value the opinions of our stockholders and will carefully consider the outcome of the vote when making future compensation decisions for our Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you own shares through a bank, broker or other holder of record, you must instruct them how to vote so that your vote can be counted on this proposal as uninstructed shares are not entitled to vote with regard to Proposal 2.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The affirmative vote of a majority of the shares present in person or represented by proxy and entitled to vote is required to approve this Proposal 2.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your Boards Recommendation: FOR Proposal 2
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Discussion and Analysis
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee of our Board of Directors oversees our compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation program is designed to specifically address our desire to motivate and retain several different groups of employees with disparate characteristics which are described below:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: our President and Chief Executive Officer (CEO), our principal executive officer, the Executive Vice President & Chief Financial Officer (CFO), our principal financial officer, and our other three most highly-compensated executive officers during the last fiscal year (collectively, the Named Executive Officers) and other senior vice presidents (collectively with the Named Executive Officers, the Senior Executives);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the remaining officers of the Company and our subsidiaries, other than our Senior Executives (the Other Corporate Officers);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: our key professional employees other than our Senior Executives and Other Corporate Officers (collectively, the Key Professional Employees); and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: all of our remaining full-time employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program is designed to pay our Senior Executives a significant amount of their compensation in equity of the Company, a substantial portion of which is determined based on the actual performance of the Company in the prior calendar year relative to our peers in order to incentivize our Senior Executives to consistently build long-term stockholder value and to align our executives with our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following Compensation Discussion and Analysis explains how the Compensation Committee has structured our executive compensation program to achieve this objective.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although this section of the Proxy Statement specifically addresses the compensation program for our Senior Executives and, in particular, the Named Executive Officers, we are focused on the compensation of all of our employees and structuring all of our compensation programs to reward behavior that we believe will ultimately increase stockholder value, and the Compensation Committee considers compensation programs for all of the employees with the focus of tying a substantial portion of compensation to the Companys performance and creation of stockholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Named Executive Officers for 2016 appearing in the Proxy Statement are:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Name Position Jeffrey L. Ventura Chairman, President and Chief Executive Officer Roger S. Manny Executive Vice President  Chief Executive Officer Ray N. Walker, Jr.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following chart shows the performance of a $100 investment in our common stock on December 31, 2011, with dividends invested quarterly, for those who wish to consider total stockholder return when evaluating compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recent negative performance is a result of the impact of significantly lower prices for natural gas, natural gas liquids, and oil, particularly in the Appalachian basin, and the resulting financial performance of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Objectives of Our Executive Compensation Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our fundamental strategy to create value for the Companys stockholders is to emphasize the cost effective creation of long-term oil and gas development projects from the ground up.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To do so effectively, especially in the continued environment of low commodity prices, requires an outstanding group of talented individuals working together as a team and to do so with a resilient financial and cost structure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With the low commodity price environment we continue to operate in, we must prioritize:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: capital discipline;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: cost reduction; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: preservation of our financial flexibility over growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Over the longer term, we believe our fundamental strategy of growing production per share and reserves per share at reasonable cost remains the key to building stockholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To cope with the financial challenges we face, we have significantly reduced our workforce with office closures and reductions in force.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the sale of assets over the last several years has resulted in further decreases in our staffing.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For our remaining employees, we have limited compensation increases and bonuses but strived to maintain competitive long-term compensation arrangements to challenge and encourage our teams to continuously improve operations, look for further cost reductions, create capital efficiencies and improve economic returns despite lower commodity prices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We expect our compensation strategy to result in appropriate economic rewards for individuals being asked to do more with less, which benefits our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The fundamental strategy of creating alignment of the interests of our employees with the interests of our stockholders is not new, although the methodology of achieving it has changed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since 1989, we have granted long-term equity incentive awards to virtually all of our full-time employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that, as a result, our employees think, act and feel like owners of the Company and they understand and are more focused on how each of them contributes to our long-term goal of finding and producing natural gas, NGLs and oil at top quartile performance levels while managing costs and our financial structure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Over time, the form and structure of our long-term equity incentive awards have changed but we continue to believe similar long-term equity awards granted to our Senior Executives should also be awarded to all Other Corporate Officers and Key Professional Employees to maintain a pay for performance culture aligned with the stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our guiding principle for our compensation program is to achieve one main objective: Align our employees interests with the interests of our stockholders by rewarding performance that advances the strategic plan of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Highlights of Compensation Program Policies for Named Executive Officers
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What We Do     What We Dont Do  Majority of Named Executive Officers compensation is at risk and performance based, which links pay to performance    No individual change in control contracts All long-term incentive awards are payable in stock   No backdating or repricing of stock options Financial performance metrics underlying long-term incentive awards are objective and aligned with stockholders interests   No employee contracts Perform annual say-on-pay advisory vote for stockholders   No accelerated vesting of equity awards in the event of a change- in-control without a qualifying termination under the Management CIC Plan Maintain robust stock ownership goals for Senior Executives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each element of our executive compensation program is intended to further this fundamental objective.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Even in times of difficulty in our business sector, we know that to retain our employees we have to pay competitively, we have to benchmark our pay practices and we have to compare the Companys performance to other companies in our sector.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To do so, each year the Compensation Committee establishes a group of companies that, for the year, we refer to as the Peer Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our use of cash compensation as a relatively lower percentage of total compensation and our policy of considering all full-time employees for long-term equity awards serves to align the interests of our employees with the interests of our executives and stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholder Approval of Executive Compensation and Ongoing Engagement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the 2016 Annual Meeting, stockholders continued to express their support of Ranges executive compensation program, as approximately 93% of voting stockholders voted FOR Ranges advisory vote on executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee interpreted this strong level of stockholder support as affirmation of the elements and objectives of the Ranges executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Range is committed to responsiveness to stockholders views and to continually reviewing its practices with respect to executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, members of the management team engaged with many of Ranges largest stockholders regarding executives compensation, and based on these meetings, effective May 2017, the following summarizes the adjustments to the executive compensation program:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Drilling rate of return was added as a performance criteria for the annual cash bonus program with a weight of 15% and absolute stock price was removed;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The payout percentage of 12.5% of the performance shares awarded in 2017 will be based on a debt-adjusted reserve growth per share metric; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The payout percentage of 12.5% of the performance shares awarded in 2017 will be based on a debt-adjusted production growth per share.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Company agreed to implement a policy that will provide for at least one opportunity, on an annual basis, for at least five of the then ten largest holders (based on beneficial ownership of common stock) to meet with either the lead independent director or, in the alternative, two or more independent directors, for the purpose of encouraging stockholder feedback to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RANGE RESOURCES CORPORATION - 2017 Proxy Statement    35
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Back to Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Overview of Executive Compensation Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Primary Compensation Elements for 2016 (Based on 2015 Performance)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee is mindful of the necessity to align our compensation policies with overall Company strategic objectives and regularly considers the possibility of misalignment when evaluating compensation policies, programs and decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result of this ongoing review, the Committee and the Company do not believe that the Companys compensation policies or practices are reasonably likely to have a material adverse effect on the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In particular, the Committee believes the criteria used by the Committee with regard to Senior Executive annual cash bonuses provide a significant mitigant against encouraging excessive risk taking in connection with key management decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specifically, the use of finding and development cost as a factor in the bonus determination results in increased bonus opportunities for creating and maintaining a low cost structure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This in turn serves as a significant risk mitigant in a commodity industry where the price of the commodity can vary significantly because the long term success of commodity companies is much more likely with a low breakeven cost structure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Use of reserves and production growth per share, two other key executive cash bonus compensation criteria, encourage prudent, measured and thoughtful growth through the drillbit and acquisitions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committees practice of debt adjusting the growth metrics prevents rewarding risk taking through highly leveraged transactions and expansions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The use of EBITDAX tied to the business plan as an executive compensation criterion encourages risk mitigation through hedging and continuous cost control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other policies and practices utilized by the Company to mitigate risk in compensation include not using pay and bonus structures that could encourage cost centers to take risk to become profit centers, therefore activities such as treasury, investing and hedging outcomes are not separately financially rewarded.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The use of certain of these criteria for annual bonus determinations has resulted in the award of cash bonuses even in years where the Company has a negative TSR.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payment of cash compensation for short term performance in difficult economic times is, in the view of the Committee, consistent with the long-term best interest of stockholders by incentivizing short-term cost containment and capital efficiency and the willingness of management to make difficult decisions in challenging economic circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee strongly believes that in order to achieve our compensation objectives it is important to review and compare our financial and operating performance with that of the Peer Group companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, the total compensation for each of our Senior Executives is determined in May of each year and is based on our prior year performance compared to the prior year performance of the Peer Group and includes an analysis of compensation paid by the Peer Group to employees in comparable Senior Executive positions for that prior year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The difference in the cash compensation paid to each Senior Executive (including compensation we consider the equivalent of cash compensation described in this Compensation Discussion and Analysis) and the total compensation for each Senior Executive which is awarded by the Committee based on our performance relative to the Peer Group is paid solely in long-term equity awards which have vesting and performance characteristics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The methodology for linking the awarded equity grants to the Companys performance is described in more detail below under the captions Components of Executive Compensation and Allocation Among Types of Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes this Proxy Statement details how the Committee has linked Senior Executive compensation, and in particular, equity compensation, with the Companys actual performance for the full year prior to when it is granted and in the use of the performance-based shares in the way in which it is ultimately paid.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the Compensation Committee will continue to evaluate its compensation policies in response to the results of the advisory say on pay proposal and, potentially on the report of any of the proxy advisory services, based on the extensive work done by the Committee and its independent compensation consultant to develop an equity grant program that includes the performance-based share awards for 50% of the equity awarded (which itself has a performance criteria included) and the after the fact evaluation of realizable pay in light of the decline in value of the Companys common stock in two of the last three years, the Committee is confident that its process for setting compensation for Senior Executives is very effective in aligning pay with performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RANGE RESOURCES CORPORATION - 2017 Proxy Statement    36

sentences.text: The alignment of our executive compensation with our stockholders is evident when the amount of realizable compensation is compared to the gran date value of the awards which is the amount the Committee intended to award the executives for their performance.
