sentences.text: Setting Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Role of the Compensation Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee oversees our compensation benefit plans and policies, administers our stock plans (including reviewing and approving equity grants to all officers of the Company and its subsidiaries) and reviews and approves all compensation decisions relating to our Senior Executives and Other Corporate Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee is empowered by the Board of Directors and by the Compensation Committees Charter to make all the decisions regarding compensation for all of our employees without ratification or other action by the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RANGE RESOURCES CORPORATION - 2017 Proxy Statement    37
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Back to Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with applicable New York Stock Exchange (NYSE), Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (the Code), and SEC regulations, the Compensation Committee is composed of four independent, non-management members of the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance and Nominating Committee recommended the appointment of these directors to serve on the Compensation Committee after determining that they had the independence, knowledge and skills to accomplish the scope of responsibilities set out in the Compensation Committees Charter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has the authority to secure services for executive compensation matters, legal advice or other expert services, both from within the Company and from independent third party advisors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In his role as Chairman of the Compensation Committee, Mr. Kevin McCarthy sets the Compensation Committees meeting agendas, meeting times and calendar.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. McCarthy generally coordinates with our CEO and CFO so that all appropriate compensation matters are included on the agendas for Compensation Committee meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Compensation Committee members communicate frequently with each other concerning compensation matters outside of the regularly scheduled Compensation Committee meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, Mr. Funk, as the Boards Lead Independent Director, regularly attends Compensation Committee meetings and, while not a member of the Committee, prior to his appointment as Lead Independent Director, Mr. Funk served on the Compensation Committee and is also requested to provide input to the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has not delegated any authority to act on behalf of the Compensation Committee to any other committee of the Board of Directors or to any member of our management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Role of Executive Officers
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, our CEO submits recommendations to the Compensation Committee for adjustments to the salary, bonuses and long-term equity incentive awards payable to all employees, including himself.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee considers the recommendations of our CEO as only one factor, in addition to the other factors described in this Compensation Discussion and Analysis, in setting our Senior Executive and other employee compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As Senior Executives, Other Corporate Officers and Key Professional Employees are hired and promoted during the year, our CEO or CFO (to whom the Companys Human Resources Department reports) make recommendations to the Compensation Committee for long-term equity incentive award grants during interim periods for newly-hired or promoted employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event the Company hired a Senior Executive, our CEO would work closely with the Compensation Committee in negotiating compensation arrangements for potential Senior Executives to ensure that our compensation arrangements are consistent with our existing compensation strategies and philosophy and are approved by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the request of the Compensation Committee, our CEO and our CFO attend certain meetings and work sessions of the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee also individually reviews and approves all compensation granted to our Senior Executives and Other Corporate Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There are currently eight Senior Executives and 19 Other Corporate Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Role of the Compensation Consultant
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since September 2006, the Compensation Committee has engaged Alvarez & Marsal Taxand, LLC (Alvarez & Marsal) as its independent compensation consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee directs, and works extensively with, Alvarez & Marsal to determine how Peer Group executive officer compensation data should be quantified and valued in comparison with our compensation arrangements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These comparisons include valuing Peer Group equity awards with different vesting and expiration terms than the awards we grant to our employees in order to make valid equity comparisons.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since the Compensation Committee retained Alvarez & Marsal, the Company has not engaged, and will not engage, Alvarez & Marsal to advise us on any matters other than those issues authorized by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Company paid Alvarez & Marsal a total of $243,000 for consulting services related to executive and director compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In June 2013, the Committee was provided a detailed analysis of Alvarez & Marsals independence with regard to its relationship to the Company and the Committee concluded that Alvarez & Marsal is, in fact, independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2014, 2015 and 2016, the Committee received additional information about Alvarez & Marsals independence and confirmed its previous determination that Alvarez & Marsal remains independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With the approval of the Compensation Committee, the Company has retained Alvarez & Marsal to provide valuation services relating to the Companys use of performance restricted stock awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In particular the valuations of the performance share awards granted in 2014, 2015 and 2016 were calculated by Alvarez & Marsal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under this engagement, the Company may request Alvarez & Marsal to provide quarterly updates to these valuations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Given the limited scope of these consulting services, the Compensation Committee determined that the Companys engagement of Alvarez & Marsal did not impair the firms independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the instruction of the Compensation Committee, Alvarez & Marsal works primarily with our CFO and Vice President of Finance to gather the Peer Group data necessary to create a meaningful comparison with our data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All contact between our Senior Executives and Alvarez & Marsal as the independent compensation consultant is approved by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Use of Tally Sheets
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In its analysis of the appropriate compensation for each Senior Executive, the Compensation Committee reviews a summary report or tally sheet prepared by Alvarez & Marsal for each individual.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This includes each Senior Executives salary, performance-based annual cash incentive award, long-term equity incentive awards, retirement and other benefits and any other compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The tally sheets reflect the total annual compensation for each Senior Executive, as well as the potential payments under selected performance scenarios, termination of employment and change in control scenarios.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In valuing termination and change in control payments, we calculate the total payments under each of the potential termination or change in control scenarios that are contemplated under the Range Resources Corporation Executive Change in Control Severance Benefit Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purpose of the tally sheets is to bring together all of the elements of actual and potential future compensation of our Senior Executives so that the Compensation Committee can analyze both the individual elements of compensation as well as the aggregate amount of actual and potential future compensation for each Senior Executive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RANGE RESOURCES CORPORATION - 2017 Proxy Statement    38
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Use of Peer Group Comparisons
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee seeks to maintain a Peer Group that is generally similar to us with respect to business activity and specifically focuses on companies engaged in exploration for and production of oil and gas resources with Range having a market capitalization near the median of the Peer Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviews the composition of the Peer Group with advice from Alvarez & Marsal in the first quarter of each calendar year and any additions or deletions are made to the Peer Group at that time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, companies that are acquired or merged during the year are eliminated from that years Peer Group to the extent such acquisitions or mergers prevent the company from being an appropriate member of the Peer Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Components of Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that compensation paid to our employees, including our Senior Executives, should be both competitive with the Peer Group and closely aligned with our performance on both a short-term and long-term basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Senior Executive compensation program is also designed to assist us in attracting and retaining executives critical to our long-term success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, our Senior Executive compensation is structured to ensure that a significant portion of the compensation is contingent upon strong relative stock performance, financial results and operating results that directly and indirectly influence stockholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To that end, the Compensation Committee believes that our Senior Executive compensation program should consist principally of the following components:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: base salary;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: annual performance-based annual cash incentive awards;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: long-term equity incentive awards based on the Companys actual performance relative to its peers; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: only those retirement and other benefits substantially the same as provided to other employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RANGE RESOURCES CORPORATION - 2017 Proxy Statement    39
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Back to Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that equity compensation is an important element of our compensation philosophy for our full-time employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consequently, we currently provide one or more of the following long-term equity incentive awards to our employees, including our Senior Executives:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: restricted stock grants which are ultimately awarded in an amount determined by applying a performance multiplier from 0% to 150% and which ultimately vest at the end of the three year performance period (Performance Shares) as described above;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: restricted stock units (RSUs) which vest over a three-year period; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: unvested discretionary contributions to our deferred compensation plan, which participating officers may elect to be made in our common stock o in cash (if elected in stock, Annual Stock Awards) both of which vest over a three-year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the long-term equity incentive awards listed above, the Company provides the following retirement and other benefits to our employee including our Senior Executives:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: cash matching contributions to our 401(k); and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: matching contributions to our deferred compensation plan, which a participating officer can elect to have contributed in our common stock (Matching Stock Awards) or in cash, both of which vest over a three-year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Determining Relative Performance Compared to the Peer Group
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee, with assistance from Alvarez & Marsal, determines total executive compensation for our Senior Executives based on our performance relative to the Peer Group, measured by comparing performance measures that the Compensation Committee believes to be key indicators of superior performance for oil and gas exploration and production companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described in more detail below, the Compensation Committee uses long-term equity incentive awards as the final element of total compensation; however, the Committee only determines total compensation once it has assessed the Companys actual performance relative to the Peer Group for the prior calendar year and establishes total compensation (and thus the amount of equity awards granted) based on the Companys actual performance relative to the Peer Group as described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Thus, during May 2016, the Compensation Committee awarded long-term equity incentive awards for each Senior Executive for 2015 based on our relative performance compared to the Peer Group for 2015 and the total compensation received for 2015 by executive officers in the Peer Group (omitting from the peer compensation certain companies and certain compensation elements the Committee, with input from Alvarez & Marsal, determined were not appropriate for inclusion to determine the amount of pay to be used for benchmarking).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to evaluate the Companys performance as compared to the Peer Group companies, the information for the Peer Group for 2015 was taken from each companys audited financial statements for 2015 along with the compensation information for 2015 disclosed in each companys 2016 proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To evaluate the Companys relative performance to the peer companies, each company in the Peer Group was measured in seven categories for 2015 results:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: drill-bit finding and development costs;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: cash flow growth per share;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: debt-adjusted production growth per share;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: debt-adjusted reserve growth per share;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: recycle ratio;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: stock price appreciation; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: cash margin.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee then considered the same criteria for the Companys 2015 performance and determined the Companys actual 2015 performance relative to the Peer Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This analysis showed that the Companys performance was at the 74th percentile.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has determined not to be bound by a formulaic application of the performance percentile when setting total compensation and regularly uses negative discretion to establish the percentile that it applies before the step described below of setting each individual Senior Executives total compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Negative discretion means that the Compensation Committee reduces the compensation amounts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes that the use of actual Peer Group company performance compared to the Companys actual performance, after the fact and based on audited financial results, allows the Committee to make a well-informed judgment with regard to the performance of the Company and the Senior Executives as compared to the Peer Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The determination of the Companys relative performance to the Peer Group is one of the most important steps in setting the Companys executive compensation and is the key to the Committees view that it awards pay directly linked to actual performance by the Company relative to its peers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, the Committee and its independent consultant devote a significant amount of time to
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: establishing a Peer Group that challenges the Senior Executives with the inclusion of strong performing peer companies including peer companies larger than the Company;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: considering performance metrics for comparison that the Committee views as key to the success of the Company; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: when determining total compensation (which itself directly determines the amount of equity compensation awarded), eliminating from consideration as a Peer Group member any company that would unrealistically skew the Companys relative performance or the compensation awarded to a particular executive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No compensation is granted in anticipation of future performance; time vesting is an additional restriction placed upon compensation already earned for past performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes that the practice of granting equity compensation for past, actual performance relative to peers, combined with that compensation being at risk during the vesting period (a retention tool), is a rigorous process of granting long-term equity awards in a way that reflects consistent alignment with the Companys actual performance relative to its peers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes that its methodology results in each Senior Executives total compensation being directly based on the Companys performance relative to its peers and therefore provides a very strong culture of pay for performance for the Senior Executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described in the section below entitled Long-Term Equity Incentive Compensation, beginning with equity awards granted to Senior Executives in May 2014, the Committee granted a combination of 50% Performance Shares and 50% Annual Stock Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RANGE RESOURCES CORPORATION - 2017 Proxy Statement    40
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Back to Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Determining Individual Total Compensation of our Senior Executives and Use of Relative Performance to Establish Total Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining an individual Senior Executives total compensation to be awarded, the Compensation Committee reviewed the compensation paid in 2015 to the corresponding comparable executives in the Peer Group as compiled from the 2016 proxy data by Alvarez & Marsal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In reviewing compensation for our Senior Executives, data from certain Peer Group companies was omitted where the Committee believed the pay included elements that were inconsistent with the Companys pay philosophy or where the Peer Company was much larger than the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, data for certain positions in some companies in the Peer Group was excluded where the Compensation Committee determined that total compensation at a Peer Group company was not comparable or was affected by non-comparable factors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By excluding companies from the Peer Group used for benchmarking executive pay but including those same companies for the relative performance analysis, the Committee believes that the Companys relative performance is more rigorously judged, but the potential effect of increasing the pay benchmark by including much larger companies or companies with a different compensation philosophy is avoided.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In those instances where a comparable position for a Senior Executive did not exist in the Peer Group or the Peer Group data was not considered adequately comparable, the Compensation Committee used a relative ranking of the compensation paid to the five most highly compensated officers at that Peer Group company to determine compensation for comparison purposes with our Senior Executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Once the appropriate total compensation for a particular position is determined, the proposed total compensation for each Senior Executive of the Company is calculated using the percentile performance level determined in the Peer Group performance comparison described in the previous section entitled Determining Relative Performance Compared to the Peer Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After determining the performance-based total compensation for each Senior Executive for 2015 performance, the Compensation Committee reviewed with Alvarez & Marsal the relative differences among total compensation amounts between each of our Senior Executives, especially between our CEO and our other Senior Executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee determined that relative differences in the total compensation provided to our Senior Executives were reasonable before finalizing total compensation for each Senior Executive and adjusting the total compensation as appropriate given the Companys performance and the individual Senior Executives performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the Committee has the authority to increase total compensation for a Senior Executive, the Committee believes upward adjustments from the total compensation determined based on the performance and Peer Group benchmark should be limited to extraordinary circumstances and it did not make any upward adjustments in setting Senior Executive compensation in May 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base Salary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviews the base salaries of our Senior Executives on an annual basis, at the time of a promotion or changes in responsibilities and when market conditions warrant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base salaries for our Senior Executives are targeted at the 50th percentile of the Peer Group adjusted for certain factors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base salary of our Senior Executives are based on an evaluation of the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the complexity of their respective positions and specific technical experience required;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: experience and tenure;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the base salaries of comparable positions at Peer Group companies (omitting those with non-comparable pay practices);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: competitive market conditions; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: internal pay equity among our Senior Executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Salary adjustments for our Senior Executives have historically been approved by the Compensation Committee in May of each year and take effect on the first payroll period after approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Making salary adjustments in May of each year allows the Compensation Committee to determine compensation for our Senior Executives after the completion of the Peer Group analysis of proxy data and audited financial statements so that the Committee can consider the compensation paid during the prior calendar year to executive officers of the Peer Group companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Salary adjustments and long-term equity incentive awards for all other employees were awarded on February 10, 2016 when cash incentive awards were determined.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In May 2016, based on a recommendation from management, the Compensation Committee did not increase the base salaries of any of the Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For additional description of the base salaries paid to the Named Executive Officers, including historical salary information, please refer to the section of this Proxy Statement entitled Narrative Disclosure to Summary Compensation Table and Grants of Plan-Based Awards Table  Salaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Cash Incentive Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with our philosophy of rewarding performance and linking substantial percentages of pay with performance, we established the Amended and Restated 2005 Equity-Based Incentive Compensation Plan, which includes an annual cash incentive award program that is designed to comply with Section 162(m) of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We refer to cash awards paid under the Amended and Restated 2005 Plan as Annual Incentive Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Annual Incentive Awards are paid to each Senior Executive based on a formulaic application of certain performance criteria that are discussed more fully below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee develops the performance criteria to be used for the Annual Incentive Awards, reviews the performance criteria with Alvarez & Marsal and then discusses the performance criteria with our CEO and CFO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee then sets the criteria as well as the weighting and performance achievement levels necessary to calculate Annual Incentive Awards based upon payout percentages established for each Senior Executive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the performance criteria were based upon either industry standards or our annual business plan (the Annual Business Plan).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Annual Business Plan is a forecast of expected business results for the applicable fiscal year based upon certain assumptions made by our management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that the performance criteria, taken together, are strong objective indicators of the Companys performance, thus similar factors are typically used in determining the Companys performance relative to its Peer Group for setting total compensation and long-term equity awards as described above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RANGE RESOURCES CORPORATION - 2017 Proxy Statement    41
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Back to Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Annual Incentive Awards are subject only to the negative discretion of the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Incentive Awards are determined without reference to Peer Group data, because each performance criteria has been pre-established by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Annual Incentive Awards for our Senior Executives are paid in February of each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe these Annual Incentive Awards are deductible by the Company for tax purposes in the year paid.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Target Annual Incentive Awards are determined as a percentage of each Senior Executives base salary paid during the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This target percentage is established through an analysis of compensation for comparable positions in the Peer Group and is intended to provide a competitive level of compensation if the Company achieves the performance criteria established by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Four of the performance criteria are internal performance measures and the fifth performance criterion (absolute stock price performance) is an external performance measure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Finding and development costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The first criterion the Compensation Committee selected for 2016 was finding and development costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that finding and development costs is one of the key measurements of the performance of an oil and gas exploration and production company and one that is used by financial analysts to evaluate our performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee specified that, in determining our finding and development costs, only cash costs incurred in connection with exploration and development would be used, and the costs of acquisitions would be excluded because the Board of Directors approves each material acquisition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining the reserve additions for this calculation, any reserve revisions for changes in commodity prices between years are excluded, but any performance related reserve revisions are included.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In setting the performance levels (i.e., threshold, target and excellent) for finding and development costs, the Compensation Committee considers historical finding and development costs of the Peer Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our 2016 finding and development costs performance, as compared with the targets, was achieved primarily through focusing drilling capital in areas which added new reserves at a cost that is lower than the oil and gas industry in general.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EBITDAX.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The second criterion the Compensation Committee selected for 2016 was EBITDAX.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EBITDAX is calculated by adding back exploration expense, interest expense and depletion, depreciation and amortization expense to income before income taxes (adjusted for asset sales), excluding any non-cash revenues and expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee selected this criterion to measure our ability to achieve the results targeted by our Annual Business Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee determined that the EBITDAX measure was appropriate because it captures our ability to adapt to the impact of changing commodity prices as well as changing costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 EBITDAX performance levels were based on the 2016 Annual Business Plan (adjusted for the Memorial acquisition), which reflected an EBITDAX level of $671 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our actual 2016 EBITDAX totaled $723 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Production and reserve growth per share.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The third and fourth criteria the Compensation Committee selected for 2016 were production growth per share and reserves growth per share.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that it is important to measure our growth on a per share basis so our Senior Executives are incentivized to build long-term stockholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Two essential measurements of performance are growth in production and reserves on a debt adjusted per share basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Production and reserves used in the calculation of these criteria are based on reported production and year-end reserves, adjusted for price revisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The calculation is debt adjusted to ensure that per share growth was not achieved solely by increasing leverage.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We did not achieve the 2016 performance in either of these categories, as compared with our performance target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Absolute Stock price performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The fifth criterion the Compensation Committee selected for 2016 was the absolute performance of our common stock during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that absolute performance in stock appreciation is an appropriate measure to include as it is obviously one that stockholders experience directly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to selecting the performance criteria, the Compensation Committee determined, after consultation with Alvarez & Marsal, the respective performance payout percentages for each of our Senior Executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining these payout percentages, the Compensation Committee attempted to ensure that the payouts provided meaningful incentives to each of our Senior Executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the annual incentive payout percentage was a weighted average of the payout percentage for each category using the percentages set forth below in the table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When actual results achieved fall between the performance levels, the percentile performance used to determine the payout percentage is proportionately adjusted between the performance levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committees policy is to pay the Annual Incentive Awards for each year in February of the following year based upon our performance with respect to the performance criteria established by the Compensation Committee, subject only to the Compensation Committees negative discretion.

sentences.text: Long-Term Equity Incentive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: One of the fundamental philosophies of our compensation program is that all of our full-time employees are eligible to be granted long-term equity incentive awards to focus and align their interests with those of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that RSUs, Annual Stock Awards, Matching Stock Awards, and Performance Shares give employees who receive such equity awards a direct interest in our financial results and the performance of the Company, furthering our goal of aligning the interests of each employee with those of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While we believe our philosophy of making awards of equity-based compensation for Senior Executives is comparable to our Peer Group, we also believe that granting long-term equity incentive awards to virtually all full-time employees is somewhat unusual in our industry, although it has become more prevalent in recent years to grant equity awards to attract and retain employees at various levels in our industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-Term Incentive Program  Long-Term Alignment with Stockholders
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the Company typically includes three year vesting schedules for equity awards granted to our Senior Executives for retention purposes, the Committee had not applied performance-based vesting to such awards prior to 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Thus, while the long-term equity awards granted to Senior Executives in 2013 and years prior were time vested, the Committee believes that its methodology of having awarded long-term equity based almost entirely on the prior year performance of the Company relative to its Peer Group companies provided a pay for performance culture.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes past practices resulted in long-term creation of stockholder value and implemented the core philosophy of the Committee to pay a significant amount of each Senior Executives compensation including the CEOs compensation  based on the absolute and relative performance of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described previously, the Committee determined to utilize performance vesting criteria for a significant portion (50%) of the long term equity awards made to Senior Executives granted in May 2014, May 2015 and May 2016 which included Performance Shares with the following terms:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Metric  The sole performance metric is a formulaic calculation of relative total stockholder return (TSR) compared to the Peer Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Period  three years from date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payment  third anniversary from date of the grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSR calculation  Determined for the Company and each company in the Peer Group using the average stock price of each company at the beginning of the performance period based on the average closing price in the 10 day period prior to and ending at the close of business on the date of grant and at the end of the performance period using the 10 day period prior to and ending on the 3 year anniversary date of the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reinvestment of dividends is assumed and will be included in the calculation of TSR.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payout scaling  0% to 150% determined based on the TSR of the Company as compared with the TSR of each member of the Peer Group; provided, however, that the payout multiple will be no greater than 100% in the event the Company has a negative TSR for the Performance Period regardless of the Companys TSR rank.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dividends on Performance Shares  will only be paid after vesting based on the number of shares determined by the payout percentage.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payout in the event of a Change in Control  the award will vest as of the date of the consummation of a transaction resulting in a change  control with payout determined as of the date of the change in control with the Companys TSR calculated based on the transaction value receiv by stockholders and the TSR of each member of the Peer Group calculated using a 10 day period prior to the change in control.

sentences.text: Tax deductibility  Although we consider tax deductibility in the design and administration of our executive compensation plans and program, we believe there are circumstances where our interests are best served by maintaining flexibility in the way compensation is provided, even if it results in the non-deductibility of certain compensation under the Internal Revenue Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that all of the cash incentive awards and our performance shares based on total shareholder return qualify as performance-based compensation and are not subject to the deduction limitation of Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Salary, time-vested restricted stock awards and performance shares based on production and reserves growth per share do not qualify as performance-based compensation and are not exempt from the deduction limit under 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of our long-term incentive compensation program, we make unvested discretionary contributions to our deferred compensation plan on behalf of our Senior Executives and Other Corporate Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recipients of such awards can elect to receive these contributions in the form of Annual Stock Awards or in cash.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All our Senior Executives received unvested discretionary contributions in 2016 and all elected to receive Annual Stock Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As all Annual Stock Awards are credited to the recipients account in our deferred compensation plan when granted, our liability is fixed and any future appreciation of our common stock will accrue to the benefit of the award recipient without any further financial obligation for the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, for financial reporting purposes, any change in the market value of our common stock for vested stock awards held in the deferred compensation plan is required to be reflected in our earnings (i.e., if our common stock increases in value, we increase our deferred compensation expense and vice versa).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purpose of the three-year vesting schedules applicable to Annual Stock Awards, RSUs and Performance Shares is to promote employee retention.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the case of Annual Stock Awards and RSUs generally the first 30% of the awards vest on the first anniversary of the date of grant, a second 30% of the awards vest on the second anniversary of the date of grant and the remaining 40% of the awards vest on the third anniversary of the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the case of Performance Shares, as set forth above, each award will ultimately vest at the end of the three year performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On occasion, the Compensation Committee has made other grants of equity awards that have a three-year cliff vesting period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These awards have typically been granted in limited circumstances to employees who demonstrate exceptional performance and the three-year cliff vesting is used to promote retention of such employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, Annual Stock Awards, RSUs, and other equity awards have provided for, and the Performance Shares likewise provide for, the acceleration of vesting upon certain termination events, change in control or the death, disability or retirement of the employee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee chose to include these defined accelerated vesting provisions for competitive reasons as substantially all of the Peer Group companies provide similar accelerated vesting provisions in their equity compensation awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, under current accounting standard, significant adverse accounting results would occur, which would negatively impact our earnings, if the Compensation Committee retained the discretion to determine accelerated vesting on a case-by-case basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred Compensation, 401(k) and Certain Other Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred Compensation Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Senior Executives, Other Corporate Officers and directors are entitled to participate in our deferred compensation plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Currently we have one active deferred compensation plan (the Active Deferred Compensation Plan) and we have a second deferred compensation plan in which participation was frozen at the end of 2004 (the Frozen Deferred Compensation Plan).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These deferred compensation plans are described in greater detail in the section of this Proxy Statement entitled Non-Qualified Deferred Compensation Plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Active Deferred Compensation Plan, our Senior Executives and Other Corporate Officers and directors may defer a dollar amount or percentage amount of their base salary and/or annual bonus.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Currently, we match the voluntary deferrals of the employee participants, including our Senior Executives, up to 10% of their base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employee participants can elect to have the match paid in cash or Matching Stock Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We understand that the matching component of the Active Deferred Compensation Plan is not common among the Peer Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the matching component is a significant component to our compensation practices because we allow all our Senior Executives and Other Corporate Officers to participate in the plan since we do not provide any pension or retirement benefits other than the 401(k) Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee considers the matching contributions, whether paid in cash or by Matching Stock Awards, as additional cash compensation in calculating the total compensation for each Senior Executive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, when our Senior Executives receive Annual Stock Awards or the cash equivalent as described above, we contribute the awards to the Active Deferred Compensation Plan on our Senior Executives behalf, and such contributions constitute unvested discretionary contributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The investment tracking options are described in greater detail in the section of this Proxy Statement entitled Non-Qualified Deferred Compensation Plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Shares, when awarded, will not be placed into the Active Deferred Compensation Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 401(k) Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company sponsors a 401(k) Plan which is a tax-qualified retirement savings plan pursuant to which all of our full-time and part-time employees, including our Senior Executives, are eligible to contribute the lesser of up to 75% of their annual salary or the limit prescribed by law to the 401(k) Plan on a before-tax basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, participants age 50 or over may contribute additional before-tax amounts up to the annual catch-up contribution limit determined by the IRS, and any participant may contribute rollover amounts from certain other qualified plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants may also
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RANGE RESOURCES CORPORATION - 2017 Proxy Statement    45
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Back to Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: receive matching contributions, payable in cash, in an amount equal to 100% of their before-tax contributions to the 401(k) Plan up to a maximum matching contribution of 6% of their base salaries and cash bonus.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has adopted an auto-enrollment process for new employees which results in the employees participating in the 401(k) plan unless they determine not to participate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee considers the dollar value of the 401(k) matching contributions as additional cash compensation in calculating total compensation for purposes of determining the amount of long-term equity incentive compensation to award to each Senior Executive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants are 100% vested in all contributions to the 401(k) Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the other investment options available under the 401(k) Plan, participants may invest all or a portion of their 401(k) Plan account in our common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 401(k) Plan investment options for 2016 are listed in the section of this Proxy Statement entitled Non-Qualified Deferred Compensation Plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide our Senior Executives with certain other limited personal benefits the Compensation Committee determines are reasonable and consistent with our overall compensation philosophy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that these benefits are consistent with those provided to executive officers of the Peer Group companies, are an important factor in retaining our Senior Executives and are in accordance with general compensation practices in our industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Moreover, the Compensation Committee considers the cost and value of any such benefits as additional cash compensation when calculating the total cash compensation for purposes of determining the performance adjusted amount of long-term equity incentive compensation to award to each Senior Executive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We offer medical, dental, vision and life insurance and disability benefits to all eligible employees, including our Senior Executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also provide our Senior Executives with the following benefits:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) supplemental disability plans and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) reimbursement for approved spousal travel expenses related to Company business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We only provide club membership dues reimbursement and reimbursement of certain expenses to certain of our Senior Executives to the extent such membership dues and expenses are related to the conduct of our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes these particular benefits help our Senior Executives to network and foster relationships in the oil and gas industry and community that are valuable and important to our Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A Senior Executive must reimburse us for any personal club use by the Senior Executive or a member of his family.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These benefits are described in greater detail in the section of this Proxy Statement entitled Narrative Disclosure to Summary Compensation Table and Grants of Plan-Based Awards Table  Other Benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Allocation Among Types of Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Allocation Among Compensation Components
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee does not arbitrarily set allocations for the different components of compensation (i.e., base salary, Annual Incentive Awards, long-term equity incentive compensation, etc.).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base salaries for our Senior Executives are targeted at the 50th percentile of the Peer Group, subject to adjustment as described above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Incentive Awards are based upon our performance using the performance criteria established by the Compensation Committee annually and subject to the Compensation Committees negative discretion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee determines long-term equity incentive compensation amounts for each Senior Executive using the Companys relative performance compared to the Peer Group and the benchmark data from companies in the Peer Group with pay practices comparable to the Company, by deducting the total cash compensation for the year from the calculated total compensation and awarding the difference in the form of equity or equity-based awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In doing so, each Senior Executives long-term equity incentive compensation is set at a level that results in a total compensation amount that includes the base salary (targeted at 50th percentile) together with performance-based Annual Incentive Awards using Section 162(m) criteria (subject to the Committees negative discretion) and equity awards which are determined based on our performance for the year relative to the Peer Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Allocation Among Long-Term Equity Incentive Compensation Components
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to 2013, the Compensation Committee divided the value of the total long-term equity incentive awards granted to our Senior Executive and Other Corporate Officers between Annual Stock Awards and SARs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective in 2014, the Committee revised these percentages in connection with the use of Performance Shares as follows:

sentences.text: After the Compensation Committee determines the aggregate value of equity to be awarded using the Companys relative performance compared to the Peer Group and the appropriate total compensation for each Senior Executive, the Compensation Committee determines the actual number of Annual Stock Awards and Performance Shares to be issued based solely on a mathematical calculation using the closing price of our common stock on the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The fair value of a Performance Share is determined utilizing a Monte Carlo simulation model incorporating the terms of the Performance Share awards to determine the value at the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Impact of Prior Equity Awards on Current Awards  No Repricing or Cash Buyouts
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, the Compensation Committee grants long-term equity incentive awards based on the prior year relative performance of the Company to the Peer Group and applies three-year vesting to such awards for retention purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because the equity grants are determined annually based on the Companys actual performance for the year for which the compensation is being paid, the Compensation Committee does not feel it is appropriate to consider past awards and adjust compensation (including long-term equity awards) due to a strong historical stock price performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Likewise the Committee has a practice that it does not compensate employees with additional amounts of pay if the value of prior grants of long-term equity awards is lower than valued at the time of the grant, thus the Committee does not re-price equity awards or pay cash buy outs for equity awards that are not in the money.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In this way, the Committee believes that the actual performance of the Company directly affects the employees compensation actually received from the equity award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committees philosophy in this regard is the same with the use of Performance Shares, including the fact that such awards are intentionally designed such that the payout varies between 0% to 150% of the number of shares initially awarded.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax and Accounting Implications
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax Deductibility of Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 162(m) of the Code places a limit of $1,000,000 on the amount of compensation that we may deduct in any one year with respect to each of our CEO and our other three most highly paid executive officers, not including the CFO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There is an exception to the $1,000,000 limitation for performance-based compensation meeting certain requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe the Annual Incentive Awards and Performance Shares granted in 2016 are performance-based compensation meeting those requirements and, as such, should be fully deductible by us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-performance based compensation would include any salaries not deferred, distributions from the deferred compensation plans and the IRS value of any perquisites.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Senior Executives can defer a portion of their salaries and Annual Incentive Awards either under our 401(k) Plan or Active Deferred Compensation Plan, which also may defer the amount that may otherwise be deductible by us for the applicable taxable year, as we can deduct amounts contributed to the 401(k) Plan at the time the contribution is made.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock awards that vest solely with the passage of time are not considered performance-based under Section 162(m) of the Code and, as such, are not deductible by us beyond the $1,000,000 limit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, because currently all Annual Stock Awards and Matching Stock Awards to our Senior Executives are placed into our Active Deferred Compensation Plan, the deductibility of such awards are not subject to the Section 162(m) limitation until the common stock or the sale proceeds from the common stock are distributed from the deferred compensation plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The deductibility of distributions from the deferred compensation plans under Section 162(m) is dependent on
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the individual elections of each Senior Executive regarding time of payment,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) whether the Senior Executive is a covered employee at the end of the year when distributed, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) whether the aggregate amount of all non-performance based compensation exceeds the $1,000,000 deduction threshold.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If such distributions are made after a Senior Executive is retired or no longer the CEO or one of the other three most highly compensated executive officers excluding the CFO, such distributions are not subject to the 162(m) limitations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To maintain flexibility in compensating our executive officers in a manner designed to promote varying corporate goals, the Compensation Committee has not adopted a policy requiring all compensation to be tax deductible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax Consequences of Equity Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee grants RSUs to employees other than the Senior Executives and other Corporate Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We receive a compensation deduction for the value of RSUs as they vest and are included in our employees W-2 wages.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We settle payroll and withholding taxes associated with the vesting of RSUs in cash.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Stock Awards and Matching Stock Awards granted to employees are placed in each employees account in the rabbi trust for our Active Deferred Compensation Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, we do not receive any deduction for such awards until shares of our common stock or the sales proceeds from our common stock are distributed out of the plan to the individual participants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The time of distribution for these amounts is determined by the participant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Currently, we have a significant net operating loss carryover for federal tax purposes and, therefore, such deferrals do not have any current effect on the income taxes owed by us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee also grants Performance Shares to Senior Executives and other Corporate Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We receive a compensation deduction for the value of the performance shares based on total shareholder return as they vest and are included in the employees W-2 wages.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Policies Regarding Equity Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Financial Restatement/Clawback Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors policy is that the Compensation Committee, to the extent permitted by governing law, retains the sole and absolute authority to make retroactive adjustments to any cash or equity-based incentive compensation paid to our Senior Executives and Other Corporate Officers where the payment of such amounts was predicated upon the achievement of certain financial results that were subsequently the subject of a restatement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Where applicable, we will seek to recover (or clawback) any amount determined to have been inappropriately received by an individual.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Grant Timing
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee does not time, nor has the Compensation Committee in the past timed, equity grants in coordination with the release of material non-public information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Instead, we grant equity at the time or times dictated by our normal compensation process as developed by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee makes all equity grants to our Senior Executives at its scheduled meeting in May of each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This allows the Compensation Committee and its independent compensation consultant time to review the compensation of executive officers at the Peer Group companies, as reported in the Peer Group companies respective proxy statements and audited financial statements filed during the first four months of each year in order to evaluate the Companys performance relative to the Peer Group companies and the compensation paid by such Peer Group companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: None of our employees have attempted to time long-term equity incentive award grants by making grant recommendations to the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Certain Senior Executives are authorized to make requests to the Compensation Committee regarding awards for new personnel as part of the hiring process, to existing employees who are promoted or where market conditions could reduce our ability to retain key employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, these are market driven occurrences and not timing issues, and such Senior Executives only provide recommendations that may or may not be approved by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Ownership Requirements for Executive Officers and Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Senior Executives, Other Corporate Officers and directors have always held substantial amounts of our common stock; however, to formalize the policy of stock ownership for such individuals, the Compensation Committee and our Board determined to impose a minimum ownership threshold for our common stock to further ensure alignment between the interests of our Senior Executives and our stockholders as well as our directors and our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each officer listed below is expected to own a number of our shares with a value that is a multiple of the officers current base salary and each non- management director is expected to own a number of shares with a value that is a multiple of the directors annual cash retainer, as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Position Multiple Chief Executive Officer 5.0 x base salary Executive Vice President 4.0 x base salary Senior Vice President 3.0 x base salary Non-management Director 5.0 x annual cash retainer
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unless the officer has achieved the required level of share ownership, the officer is required to retain an amount equal to 50% of the net shares received as a result of any equity awards granted to the officer by the Company until he or she is in compliance with the stock ownership policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An officer must continue to retain shares in the amount required for as long as the officer is subject to the policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of the date of this Proxy Statement, all officers subject to the Stock Ownership policy are in compliance with the policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unless a director has achieved the required level of share ownership, the director is required to retain an amount equal to 50% of the net shares received as a result of any equity awards granted to the director by the Company until he or she is in compliance with the stock ownership policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A director must continue to retain shares in the amount required for as long as the director serves on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of the date of this Proxy Statement, all directors are in compliance with the policy, except for Mr. Innamorati and Mr. Palko, our newest directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Trading in the Companys Stock Derivatives and Pledging Limitation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is our policy that directors and all officers, including our Senior Executives, may not purchase or sell options on our common stock, nor engage in short sales with respect to our common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Trading by officers and directors in puts, calls, straddles, equity swaps or other derivative securities that are directly linked to our common stock is also prohibited.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the past, the Company allowed directors and officers to pledge Company equity as security for an extension of credit subject to specified limitations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective May 18, 2016, pledging of Company equity to secure any new credit is prohibited.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Only one Senior Executive, Mr. Stephens, has pledged equity to secure a line of credit and his pledged equity will not be increased in compliance with the new policy prohibiting such future pledges.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Directors have pledged Company equity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Change in Control Arrangements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There are no employment agreements currently in effect between us and any employee, including each of our Senior Executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: None of our employees, including our Senior Executives, are covered under any general severance plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event a Senior Executive terminates employment, any severance benefits payable would be determined by the Compensation Committee in its discretion, unless such termination occurred following a change in control, in which case severance may be payable pursuant to the Range Resources Corporation Amended and Restated Executive Change in Control Severance Benefit Plan (the Management CIC Plan).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Management CIC Plan was adopted in March 2005.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to the Management CIC Plan all our Senior Executives, Other Corporate Officers and certain other employees selected by the Compensation Committee (the Management Group) may be entitled to receive certain payments and benefits if there is a Change in Control of the Company and a member of the Management Group is terminated other than for Cause or resigns for Good Reason within the Protection Period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The terms Change in Control, Cause, Good Reason, and Protection Period, as used in the Management CIC Plan, are defined in the section of this Proxy Statement entitled Potential Payments upon Termination and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Change in Control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a member of the Management Group is terminated without Cause or resigns for Good Reason within the Protection Period, that participant will receive:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a lump sum payment equal to
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the participants benefit multiple multiplied by
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the sum of (A) the average of the bonuses paid or awarded to the participant for the three prior fiscal years plus (B) the participants base salary; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: for a period of years equal to the participants benefit multiple, continued participation in any medical, dental, life, disability, and any other insurance arrangement for the participant (and, if applicable, the participants spouse and eligible children) in which such person(s) were participating immediately prior to
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the date of the participants termination as determined under the Management CIC Plan, or, if greater,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the occurrence of the Change in Control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The benefit multiples applicable to the Named Executive Officers are as follows: Mr. Ventura  three; Mr. Manny  two and one-half; Mr. Walker  two and one-half; Mr. Stephens  two and Mr. Poole - two.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, all non-vested equity based compensation awards held by each participant vest upon the occurrence of a Change in Control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Explanation of Significant Components of Management CIC Plan; Elimination of Tax Gross Ups for Future Participants
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Changes in control are common among oil and gas exploration and production companies and change in control arrangements are a significant and customary compensation policy that is necessary to attract and retain experienced employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee therefore determined that the Company should provide change in control protection and adopted the Management CIC Plan, which it believes fairly balances our and the participants interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has concluded that a uniform plan applicable to all members of the Management Group is more efficient than negotiating separate change in control agreements with each officer or other key employee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committees rationale behind the design of the material provisions of our Management CIC Plan is described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A more detailed description of these provisions is provided in the section of this Proxy Statement entitled Potential Payments upon Termination and Change in Control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Double Trigger Change of Control Termination Payment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee determined that, in order for the Management CIC Plan to be fair to the Companys interests, any payments should occur only after a double trigger event.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This means that no cash severance or benefit continuance will be received under the Management CIC Plan unless both
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) a Change in Control occurs and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the participant is terminated other than for Cause or resigns for Good Reason within the Protection Period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Definition of Change in Control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee developed the definition of Change in Control in consultation with our legal counsel.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under this definition, a Change in Control does not occur unless the transaction potentially triggering a Change in Control is actually consummated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefit Multiple.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee determined the benefit multiple applicable to the Named Executive Officers (in the amounts set forth above) based on the payment multiples for comparable positions with the companies in the Peer Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The three times multiple selected for our CEO is the dominant multiple used by members of the Peer Group for comparable positions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee also determined that, based on the range in multiples paid to chief financial officers and chief operating officers by other companies, our CFO and COO should receive a two and one-half times multiple, which is the midpoint of the range.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Similarly, the benefit multiples for our Other Corporate Officers were set at two times.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Protection Period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that in our circumstances any terminations would most likely occur within the first 12 months after the consummation of a Change in Control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, the Compensation Committee determined that an extended protection period after 12 months was not necessary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax Reimbursement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Management CIC Plan as adopted included a tax gross up provision which provides for the payment to participants if amounts payable under the Management CIC Plan or payable pursuant to other arrangements between the participant and the Company (the Change in Control Payments) would result in excess parachute payments under Section 280G of the Code and entitles the participant to receive an amount equal to
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) any excise tax that would be imposed under Section 4999 of the Code (the 4999 Excise Tax) with respect to the Change in Control Payments,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) federal, state, and local taxes applicable to payment of the 4999 Excise Tax and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) any additional 4999 Excise Tax amounts that are assessed by reason of payment of the tax payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee recognizes that tax gross ups are disfavored and, while the Management CIC Plan has not been revised since December 2008, the Committee re-evaluated whether to limit or eliminate the gross up provision.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After consulting with Alvarez & Marsal regarding the effect of the change to Performance Shares as a substantial part of the equity awards to Senior Executives and the fact that the use of Performance Shares creates a potential for the Senior Executives to incur significant 4999 Excise Tax where prior to the use of Performance Shares there would have been no 4999 Excise Tax liability, the Committee determined to eliminate the rights under the gross up provision for any employees who become officers after the Committees action.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not provide any pension benefits to any of our employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of our full-time and part-time employees may receive matching contributions equal to 100% of the employees 401(k) Plan contribution for an amount up to 6% of the employees base salary and cash bonus (subject to the maximum allowable deferrals set forth in the Code).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, our Senior Executives, Other Corporate Officers and directors may defer all or portions of their current compensation into our Active Deferred Compensation Plan in order to provide for retirement and wealth accumulation planning.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Historically, we have matched up to 10% of a participants base salary to encourage the deferral of current compensation by our Senior Executives and other participating employees for retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We offer other benefits such as medical, dental, vision and life insurance and group disability coverage to all eligible employees, including each of our Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide supplemental individual executive disability policies for our Senior Executives, which increases each Senior Executives disability payments above the $180,000 maximum under the group disability plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such supplemental coverage varies for each Senior Executive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The value of this supplemental coverage is detailed later in this Proxy Statement in the section entitled Other Post-Employment Payments.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN
